Most Illustrious Señor Cerro Largo, October 3, 1842

Dear friend. Moved by the friendship you have kindly granted me and which I value to the degree it deserves, and wishing on the other hand to serve a friend, I address you, troubling your attention, so that you may kindly instruct me on the points referred to in the attached document, with the promptness possible.

On this occasion, I remain as always your true friend, wishing to have the satisfaction that you occupy the uselessness of your sure servant who kisses your hands. Manuel de Aleman

Postscript

Most illustrious citizen Don Domingo José de Almeida — Bagé.

Replied to on October 22, 1842.

It was attached to the letter from Manuel de la Hoz of October 2, 1842.
